definition: auxiliary verb introducing future action: may (be able to)/will (cause)/should (enable)/going to
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: Thermal protector in motor will interrupt current when motor overheats .
sentences.chinese: 電機過熱時，熱保護器將會中斷電流。

sentences.english: Hunting without a license will land you in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 無證狩獵將會使你陷入麻煩。

sentences.english: The results will be reported in scientific journals in the near future" , said Dr Vallotton."
sentences.chinese: 不久的將來，其結果將會發表在學術刊物上。

sentences.english: I have no idea what they are going to say, so I'll have to play it by ear.
sentences.chinese: 我一點不知道他們將會說什麼，所以我只好見機行事。

sentences.english: Once your head hits the pillow you will probably sleep very fast.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你的腦袋黏上枕頭，你將會很快入睡。

sentences.english: If you give an option of failure deep within yourself, you will fail.
sentences.chinese: 如果你內心深處給了自己失敗的選項，你將會失敗。

sentences.english: Advanced Aeronautics booster color changes for Apollo and Carrier Drones.
sentences.chinese: 先進航空學將會改變阿波羅和艦載機的加速器顏色。

sentences.english: This announcement will arouse a feeling of anger among freedom-loving people.
sentences.chinese: 這一宣告將會激起愛好自由人們的憤怒。

sentences.english: The wedding will be held at Fuji Mount in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 婚禮將會在日本富士山舉行。

sentences.english: I will talking with my manager about the bank transfer by Western tomorrow morning.
sentences.chinese: 明日我將會和我們經理討論通過西聯收款的問題。

sentences.english: Everyone in the energy business believes that carbon-pricing will come, but when?
sentences.chinese: 能源行業的每一個人都認爲將會對碳定價，但何時呢？

sentences.english: This error will disappear after the main program has been defined.
sentences.chinese: 在您完成主程序的定義之後，該錯誤將會消失。

sentences.english: I think he will be the best of the best.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲，他將會成爲出色球員中的佼佼者。

sentences.english: Like humans, marmosets that die from the disease do so within 20 days of becoming ill.
sentences.chinese: 如同人類，絨猴患病後的20天內將會死亡。

sentences.english: If we have abnormalities in practice, we will be amended .
sentences.chinese: 如果我們在作法上有異常情況，我們將會修正。

sentences.english: The research could lead to new therapies for preventing cancer metastasis.
sentences.chinese: 這項研究將會引發癌轉移的新療法。

definition: will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
plan/project/program/to plan/to map out/CL:個|个[ge4],項|项[xiang4]
on the eve of/to be about to/to be on the verge of
in turn/successively/one after the other/bit by bit
and/furthermore/also/together with/(not) at all/simultaneously/to combine/to join/to merge
to have sth to do with/to relate to/related to/to concern/concerning
